page.title: 01The Parish of Ythanwells
page.content: The district gets its name from the fact that the river Ythan starts here, flowing eastwards into the Northsea at Newburgh.It consists of gentle hills, rising to about 1000ft above sealevel. It is mostly good farmland, with some plantations of firtrees and only small strips of natural vegetation of whins, broom, rushes and heather left. It is sparsely populated, as many crofts have been amalgamated to make viable farming units for a family. Most of the farms are rented from the Bognie Estate.Each farmhouse lies isolated in its own fields.In recent years several old crofthouses have been restored by people in oilrelated industries, who commute to Aberdeen.
